newsitem.title: NORWAY: Oil output normal at Phillips' Ekofisk field.
newsitem.headline: Oil output normal at Phillips' Ekofisk field.

text.p: Phillips Petroleum said on Tuesday that oil production at the North Sea Ekofisk development was back to normal after a brief 28-hour shutdown.
"We were back to normal production at 5 p.m. (1600 GMT) last night (Monday)," a spokeswoman for the company said.
Phillips shut in output at the 350,000 barrel per day field on Sunday to carry out maintenance on a pipeline.
Production at third party fields -- British Petroleum's Gyda and Ula and Amoco's Valhall and Hod -- and the Statpipe gas line was uninterrupted.
Ekofisk was shut down on January 14 for one week after a leak was discovered at another pipeline. Following that shutdown Phillips set up a regular inspection programme at the field.
